WorkItem.Description:
All in the title, if the file is not a valid Excel sheet, can't know if createReaderForFile succeeded or not.
Â 
Thanks,
WorkItem.Summary: Unable to verify if createReaderForFile succeeded

Comments.Message: createReaderForFile() should throw an exception if it fails
Wrap your call to PHPExcel_IOFactory::createReaderForFile() in a try/catch block

Nothing more, always the same error.

I use phpExcel r46471

createReaderForFile() will throw an error if it fails.
In this case, your problem is nothing to do with an error in createReaderForFile(), which does successfully return a reader.
The problem is that you're then calling the setReadDataOnly() which doesn't exist for that reader, hence the error. A CSV file can only contain data, so setReadDataOnly(true) is meaningless for CSV files.

It's not a CSV file, I test with a .php file.

But, if i understand, i must test extension of the file before i use createReaderForFile.

thanks,

createReaderForFile() is intended to autodetect filetype; but it isn't perfect, and the fallback is to consider any file as a CSV file unless it can explicitly determine that it is a file of another type.
In this case, it can't explicitly identify the filetype, hence it's returning the CSV reader.
In this case, exception can't be raised.
